content: No, the Clerk of the House of Commons is a non-partisan and impartial official who is required to remain completely neutral in their role. They are not allowed to express any personal views or opinions on any legislative matters or attempt to influence the content of Bills in any way. The Clerk must act only on behalf of the House of Commons, and their duty is to ensure that the procedural and constitutional rules of the House are being followed. Any attempt by the Clerk to influence the content of legislation would be a serious violation of their responsibilities and professional duties as an impartial official.
